intro: Cordula mastersiana, commonly known as the mastersian cordula, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens and private collections.
